column1: FTIACs are students enrolling for the First Time in any College after receiving a high school degree.
AHANA identify themselves as African-, Hispanic-, Asian-, and Native-American and are U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents. Beginning in 2010,
based on new Federal guidelines for collecting race/ethnicity data, Hawaiian/Pacific Islander and Multi-Racial students are also included here.
Knollcrest awards are not included in these figures.
Regular students are pursuing a degree from Calvin.
Guest students are enrolled at Calvin but not pursuing a degree from Calvin. This group includes exchange
students and students taking limited coursework while pursuing a degree from another institution.
Dually Enrolled Students are high school students who are also enrolled at Calvin.
Post Bac students have earned a bachelors degree and are now taking primarily undergraduate courses
as guest students or in order to earn a second bachelors degree or complete a teacher certification program.
Graduate students includes those pursuing a Masters degree or taking primarily graduate level coursework.

column3: Double Majors and Secondary Education students are counted twice. Programs with no majors are excluded.
Rhetoric was replaced by Strategic Communication in 2010-2011.
In 2010-2011, Business/CAS Group was replaced by Organizational Communication.
A 5-Year Master's Degree Program in Speech Pathology began in 2011.
In 2010-11, Film Studies and Media Studies were combined into Film & Media Studies.
In 2013-14, the Film and Media Studies major and Media Production were combined into one major--Film and Media.
Special Education Students are also counted in the Elementary Education line, but only counted once in the Education total.
Students obtaining K-12 endorsements are included in the Secondary Education counts.
The English Major was expanded to include three majors in 2011-12, while retaining the English major for Education students.
